metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8785 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The fuse_fill_write_pages function in fs/fuse/file.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a writev system call that triggers a zero length for the first segment of an iov. It was discovered that the Linux kernel's Filesystem in Userspace (FUSE) implementation did not handle initial zero length segments properly. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (unkillable task).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
